Package org.apache.heron.healthmgr

Class HealthManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.heron.healthmgr.HealthManager
  • @Unstable
@Evolving
public class HealthManager
extends java.lang.Object
    HealthManager makes a topology dynamic and self-regulating. This is implemented using Dhalion library. The HealthManager will perform the following functions to achieve its goal:
    • loads heron configuration including health policy configuration from healthmgr.yaml
    • initializing guice injector with metrics collection module from tracker or metrics cache, scheduler client and state client
    • initializes health policies instances and starts policy execution using PoliciesExecutor
    The HealthManager is executed as a process. It is recommended that it is started on container 0, colocated with the metrics provider and the scheduler service.

    Required command line options for the HealthManager include

    • cluster name: -c local
    • role: -r dev
    • environment: -e default
    • topology name: -n AckingTopology

    Optional command line options for the HealthManager include

    • health manager mode: -m local, default cluster
    • heron home directory: -d ~/.heron, required if mode is local
    • config directory: -p ~/.heron/conf, required if mode is local
    • metrics type: -s f.q.class.name, default: org.apache.heron.healthmgr.sensors.TrackerMetricsProvider
    • metrics source: -t http://host:port, default: http://127.0.0.1:8888
    • enable verbose mode: -v
